On 1/25/07, Julian Reschke <julian.reschke@...> wrote:
>
> ...but that still requires returning the right status code when you
> don't know the method name, right?

If the file / entity exists and the verb is not in (PUT, POST, DELETE,
GET, HEAD) then the flow dictates that a 405 Method Not Allowed is
returned.

Actually in my code, the method names are whitelisted and the 405 is
returned for any method name not on the whitelist (which, in my case,
would include MKCOL).

To be honest the flow described by the diagram is focused on the
resolution of the various headers, rather than the methods allowed.

Maybe there is a poential project for someone interested in WebDAV to
do the same kind of thing including other methods - not me though ;-)

Regards, Alan
